meanings.definition: A person who endorses a document.
meanings.sent1: The dorser signed the contract to show their approval.
meanings.sent2: The dorser put their signature on the paper to show support.
meanings.sent3: The dorser added their name to the agreement with a smile.
meanings.sent4: Like a stamp of approval, the dorser's signature finalized the deal.
meanings.sent5: The dorser's endorsement made the document official and binding.

meanings.definition: The back of a document where endorsements are made.
meanings.sent1: Make sure to sign on the dorser of the paper for validation.
meanings.sent2: The dorser of the form is where you should put your name.
meanings.sent3: The dorser of the letter seemed lonely without any signatures.
meanings.sent4: The dorser of the contract awaited the final approval.
meanings.sent5: The dorser of the document held the key to its validity.
